AboutYou

Methods

fetchAutocomplete(searchword, limit, types)

Returns the result of an auto completion API request. Auto completion searches for products and categories by a given prefix (searchword).
Parameters:
Name Type Description
searchword string The prefix search word to search for.
limit number Maximum number of results.
types Array.<string> Array of types to search for.
Source:
  • AboutYou.js, line 366
Returns:
Autocomplete

fetchCategoriesByIds(ids)

Returns the result of a category search API request. By passing one or several category ids it will return a result of the categories data.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
ids number | Array.<number> either a single category ID as integer or an array of IDs
Deprecated:
  • use the CategoryManager instead of
    Source:
    • AboutYou.js, line 285
    See:
    • AboutYou#getCategoryManager
    Returns:
    CategoriesResult

      fetchSuggest(searchword) → {Array.<string>}

      Returns the result of a suggest API request. Suggestions are words that are often searched together with the searchword you pass (e.g. "stretch" for "jeans").
      Parameters:
      Name Type Description
      searchword string The search string to search for.

      getCategoryManager(fetchIfEmpty)

      The Categories will be fetch automatically, if required by any other fetch method
      Parameters:
      Name Type Description
      fetchIfEmpty boolean
      Source:
      • AboutYou.js, line 147
      Returns:
      DefaultCategoryManager
      Example
      aboutYou.fetchProductsByIds([12345], ['categories']).then(function(products) {
    // will fetch the categories with the same request.
 });

aboutYou.getCategoryManager().getCategoryTree().then(function(categories) {
    // will give you all categories for your Menu without an other request
});

      getJavaScriptURL() → {string}

      Returns the URL to the ABOUT YOU JavaScript file for helper functions to add product variants into the basket of Mary & Paul or auto-resizing the Iframe. This URL may be changed in future, so please use this method instead of hardcoding the URL into your HTML template.
      Source:
      • AboutYou.js, line 500
      Returns:
      URL to the JavaScript file
      Type
      string
